org.sensorhub.impl.processing

Class SMLStreamProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sensorhub.impl.module.AbstractModule<ConfigType>
      • org.sensorhub.impl.processing.AbstractStreamProcess<SMLStreamProcessConfig>
        • org.sensorhub.impl.processing.SMLStreamProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventListener, IEventProducer, IDataProducerModule<SMLStreamProcessConfig>, IModuleWithDescription, IModule<SMLStreamProcessConfig>, IProcessModule<SMLStreamProcessConfig>, IStreamProcessModule<SMLStreamProcessConfig>

    public class SMLStreamProcess
extends AbstractStreamProcess<SMLStreamProcessConfig>

    Implementation of process module fully configured using a SensorML process chain description. The SensorML execution engine is used to execute the different processing components used in the chain.

    Since:
    Feb 20, 2015
    Author:
    Alex Robin

      protected void process(DataEvent lastEvent)
      Method called everytime a new data event has been received on any input.
      Concrete implementation must override this method to launch processing when appropriate (e.g.
      protected void scanIOList(net.opengis.OgcPropertyList<net.opengis.swe.v20.AbstractSWEIdentifiable> ioList, Map<String,net.opengis.swe.v20.DataComponent> ioMap, boolean isOutput) 
      void start()
      Starts the module with the current configuration.
      init() should always be called before start().
      void stop()
      Stops the module.
      All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
      stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.
      void updateConfig(SMLStreamProcessConfig config)
      Updates the module's configuration dynamically.
      The module must honor this new configuration unless an error is detected.

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Stops the module.
        All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
        stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.

      • process

        protected void process(DataEvent lastEvent)
                throws ProcessException
        Description copied from class: AbstractStreamProcess
        Method called everytime a new data event has been received on any input.
        Concrete implementation must override this method to launch processing when appropriate (e.g. when enough data has been received).
        Since data is accumulated in input queues, process should properly remove any data that needs to be discarded from the queues, as early as possible, even when no processing is done.
        Specified by:
        process in class AbstractStreamProcess<SMLStreamProcessConfig>
        Parameters:
        lastEvent - data event triggering this call
        Throws:
        ProcessException
